channel.title: How to shoplift like a champ
channel.description:
I searched Google for shoplifting guides to see if my methods were pointless and if there were any better methods, but every guide I found had many serious flaws and were extremely obvious. This guide is 60% me. The other 40% goes to my best friends older brother for teaching us in the ways of shoplifting like a champ. I suggest shoplifting as much as possible until you are 18, unless you get caught - I suggest stopping there. I do not have any advice on what to do if caught - as I have never been caught shoplifting, and neither will you if you follow my guide carefully. Before I teach you how to shoplift like champs, there are some guidelines we must go through.
Guideline 1
I am not sure if this happens to other people, but when I first started shoplifting, I would get very nervous handing money to the cashier, and I am not sure if they noticed. This is a big give away, calm yourself down walking out of the store or giving money to the cashier.
Guideline 2
If you 100% do not want to get caught, do this - steal an item, but buy a substantially cheaper item, like .99$ candy. Why would someone shoplift if they're buying something?
Guideline 3
NEVER steal if someone is watching you - shoppers are dickheads
Guideline 4
Don't shoplift if you are over 18. A college doesn't want to accept a jackass who got charged for stealing something stupid.
Guideline 5
If someone suspicious is following you EVERYWHERE and you already stole the items, make a quick turn and ditch your merchandise.
...On to the fun part
The big mistake most people make when they are shoplifting is they will walk into a store, go straight to the item, put it in their POCKET and walk out. This is like hanging a shoplifting sign on your chest.
This man broke the biggest rule in shoplifting like a champ. NEVER EVER EVER EVER EVER put ANYTHING into your pocket. Here is why my friend..
If you are caught, you will be made to empty your pockets and any bag of sort you are carrying.
You are not going to put the merchandise in your pocket..
Method 1
This works with any type of clothing, I have done this in girl jeans and it still works. To make sure nothing falls, you will need a belt. The item I steal all the time is a Red Bull - becuase I don't have 3$ to waste on an energy drink. Take the item and insert it between your pants and.. you, the belt will support it against your body. If you are asked to empty your pockets, do it without hesistation. Walk out the store... like a champ I have not tried it, but I guess you could put it in the back of your pants instead of the front, but this could end up being a dead giveaway.
Method 2
I personally have never tried this. A lot of sweatshirts could easily have a hole ripped between two layers of fabric, where you could easily stick something like an Ipod into to sit inside of your sweatshirt. I do not see how you could get caught doing this. Make the hole in a very awkward place, and make it very small.
[b] PLACES YOU SHOULD NEVER STEAL FROM[/b]
Target This store actually scares me. They have cameras covering EVERY inch of the store, and employees everywhere.
I have not noticed any other place, but feel free to suggest another store to add to the list.
Places you should steal from.. Drug Stores, CVS, Rite-Aid, etc. CVS is where I steal my red bulls from. Never been caught.
Wal Mart - [quote="the bank"]Myself and 4 friends spent 2 days planning a walmart shoplift. On the day of, after following everything we talked about, between the 4 of us we walked out of the store carrying over $350 in video games and two eight gig ipod nanos...all of the merchandise had their electronic triggers removed or nulled. After walking out of the store we started walking down the walkway away from the store, when 4 men came running after us. Shit got ugly there. There was a cop car on the other side of the parking lot, pretty far and wouldn't of seen anything but still enough to make my already anxious self freak out a little. We played it cool and kept on walking, with our backbacks carrying all the merchandise. When they caught up to us, they told as they were store security, and transported us to 3 separate rooms in the back of the store, each appeared to be like security closets with a nice LCD TV showing rotating images of the security cameras. I used to be so vain, that the thought of stealing the TV actually crossed my mind.
My two friends were charged with theft, all of their bags got opened on their own accord. I was not carrying anything on me except some things we used to brake those stupid electronic triggers through the wrapping, I was let go but warned that if caught again I would be charged with assisted theft.
Moral of the story: Don't steal from walmart either.[/quote] Grocery Stores Virtually no security
If anyone needs anything to be added, just PM me or post here.

item.title: How to shoplift like a champ
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:70, topic:289852”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=383140.msg4012800#msg4012800 date=1339364421]
Even if it is an old topic, if you didn’t know, Target hires employees and security to just walk around the store as a normal person to watch out for shop lifting. Source: I worked there.
[/quote]
The Kmart I work at does the same thing… And they’re really good at blending in as a shopper…[/quote]
The point of shop lifting is to not be seen by anyone even other shoppers. I’ve done it successfully 3 times, but it’s not just something I do often it’s just for kicks when I’m around my mates. One day I grabbed a can of V (which I don’t even drink soda so I gave it away), 9 packets of gum and a $2 bag of fizz wizz. It’s not hard if you know what to do

Read full topic

item.title: How to shoplift like a champ
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Jarba, post:64, topic:289852”][quote author=Elijah link=topic=383140.msg2877117#msg2877117 date=1248115300]
What my friends and I have always done is get someone we know in a department in the back of the store to ring us up. We run our card upside down, and they cancel the transaction. We get a receipt and walk out of the store. We’ve gotten so much stuff from this. And it’s nearly full proof, until they check to see why so much shit is missing, and then they run the tapes from those days of the purchases.

Recently got a laptop, ipod touch, a couple external hard drives, a camera, bluetooth headsets, etc.
[/quote]

I don’t get it.[/quote]

You get someone you know who works there, to ring you up. In the cameras eyes it looks like you are paying.

Read full topic

item.title: How to shoplift like a champ
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“flyboy63, post:56, topic:289852”]I am absolutely astounded that this type of advice is allowed to be published. Let me say where I am coming from, I am a law enforcement officer and love to lock up these morons that steel other peoples goods. Don’t you realise that by stealing goods you eventually up the price of the goods you are stealing? The store owner does this to recover the loss he has made due to stealing. Now this may not affect you because you are just going to steal them anyway, but it does have a knock on effect for the rest of the law abiding citizens. I deplore your actions, your advice and the very fact you are on this forum[/quote]I don’t steel anyone’s goods…

Read full topic

flyboy63:

I am absolutely astounded that this type of advice is allowed to be published. Let me say where I am coming from, I am a law enforcement officer and love to lock up these morons that steel other peoples goods. Don’t you realise that by stealing goods you eventually up the price of the goods you are stealing? The store owner does this to recover the loss he has made due to stealing. Now this may not affect you because you are just going to steal them anyway, but it does have a knock on effect for the rest of the law abiding citizens. I deplore your actions, your advice and the very fact you are on this forum
